meanings.definition: Moving fast or doing something in a short amount of time.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was very quick and easily outran the turtle.
meanings.sent2: She gave a quick response to the question.
meanings.sent3: The quick squirrel gathered nuts faster than the others.
meanings.sent4: His quick reflexes saved him from falling.
meanings.sent5: The quick cheetah sprinted across the savannah.

meanings.sent1: He tried to quicken his pace in solving the math problem.
meanings.sent2: The students quickly grasped the concept of addition.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's explanation quickened the student's understanding.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity quickened her desire to explore new topics.
meanings.sent5: Reading regularly can quicken your vocabulary growth.

meanings.sent1: The children were quick and full of energy at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The quick music got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent3: The quick puppy bounced around the room excitedly.
meanings.sent4: Her quick personality lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The quick pace of the game kept everyone engaged.

meanings.sent1: She had a quick reaction to the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: His quick feelings were hurt by the criticism.
meanings.sent3: The quick plant withered under the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The quick child was moved by the sad story.
meanings.sent5: The quick artist was deeply affected by the critique.

meanings.sent1: He completed the task quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She responded quickly to the urgent message.
meanings.sent3: The chef cooked the meal quickly to serve the hungry customers.
meanings.sent4: The team finished the project quickly before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter acted quickly to put out the fire.
